div.div: ἀπο-νέομαι , subj. ἀ̄πονέωνται, inf. ἀ̄πονέεσθαι, ipf. ἀ̄πονέοντο (the ᾶ is a necessity of the rhythm, and the place of these forms is at the end of the verse): return, go home; in Od. 15.308 the word applies to the real Odysseus rather than to his assumed character.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
